title: Four-Nations Tournament (1944)
text:
The Four-Nations Tournament was an exhibition international <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition which featured national football teams from <a href="North%20America">North America</a> (Caribbean) and <a href="South%20America">South America</a> which was held in April 1944. All matches were played in <a href="Willemstad">Willemstad</a>, Curaçao, where four teams played in a <a href="Round-robin%20tournament">round-robin</a> competition at <a href="Rif%20Stadium">Rif Stadium</a>. The host nation Curaçao emerged as winners of the tournament.
Players.
The "Venezuela” national team included four "Argentinians" (Casco, Mariscotti, Ruíz Díaz and Taiolli) and two "Cubans" (García Pelayo and Yarritu).
The Haiti national team included notable centerforward <a href="Joe%20Gaetjens">Joseph Gaetjens</a>, who would later score for the United States in their 1–0 upset win over England at the <a href="1950%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1950 FIFA World Cup</a>.
Rules.
Teams earned two points for a win and one point for a tie. Goal difference was the first tiebreaker, than goal average. In case of injury, substitutions were only allowed during the first half and subject to the approval of the opponents’ captain.
